p: After a 96 h AAP, whitefly midguts, haemolymph and primary salivary glands samples were prepared and subjected to SLCMV quantification. In all three organs, the copy number of virus differed significantly among three whitefly species (Kruskal-Wallis test, χ 2 = 26.495, 24.879, 14.873 for midgut, haemolymph and primary salivary gland, P < 0.05 in all cases; Fig. 4). For midgut and PSG, the highest copy number of virus was found in Asia II 1, followed by MED, and the lowest in MEAM1 ( Fig. 4A and C). Whereas for haemolymph, the highest copy number of virus was found in Asia II 1, and the copy number of virus in MED and MEAM1 was similar ( Fig. 4B).
